729349f-a.text:
Richmond Avenue, west side, between Signs Road and Rockland Avenue, showing the Emmanuel Lutheran
Church.
April, 1929
P. L. Sperr
729349f-a.folder: Richmond Avenue & Signs Road, Staten Island, NY

729659f-b.text:
(1)
150 Signs Road, north side, west of Richmond Avenue, showing an old farmhouse. It belonged to Mrs. M. D. Vroom in 1874; to Robert and Henry Vroom and Mrs. S. Brown in 1898, and to Charles. E. Griffith and Son in 1907. The view is east toward Richmond
Avenue.
June 29, 1933
P. L. Sperr
(2)
The rear of the house, looking westward. Ch the extreme right is seen the Asbury Methodist Episcopal
Church, on Richmond Avenue.
June 29, 1933
P. L. Sperr
(3)
Another view of the rear of the house and the
driveway.
June 29, 1933
P. L. Sperr
729659f-b.folder: Signs Road & Richmond Avenue, Staten Island, NY

729660f-a.text:
Signs Road, north side, midway between Richmond Avenue and Victory Boulevard, showing the Shroeder farmhouse and hot houses
(1898-1917 maps).
June 29, 1933
P. L. Sperr

729350f-b.text:
Richmond Avenue, west side, 700 feet south of Signs Road, showing the Awbury Methodist Episcopal Church, founded in 1808. This is the south side of the church. June 9, 1907
P. L. Sperr

The north side of the church.
.January 9, 1927
